page.title: 03The Gold Cross of Montacute
page.content: A man who lived at Montacute had a recurring dream telling him that he should go to the top of St. Michael's Hill above the village and dig. He ignored these dreams until, one morning, he woke to find severe scratches on his face. After this he decided to go up the hill. He took up a group of villagers and began to dig. They found a gold (cross?) artifact which was taken to Winchester Cathedral. It is believed to be there still. The hill, Mons Acutis, now has a tower on its summit, on the site of a former castle. It is a prominent feature of the landscape from many miles away.
